category: General Assembly and Board of Directors Regulations/Article 14 (Questions and Discussions)
contents: Article 14 (Questions and Discussion) ① After the proposal is explained, delegates may freely ask questions about the agenda. ② When the number of inquiries continues and it is not easy to end the inquiry, members of the general meeting may submit a motion to close the inquiry with the approval of two or more people. ③ When an agreement to close an inquiry is reached, the chairperson must ask the general meeting whether it is okay or not. ④ When there are no more people asking questions or when the motion to close inquiries pursuant to paragraph 3 is passed, the chairperson shall declare the closure of inquiries. ⑤ Once the inquiry is concluded, delegates can freely discuss for or against the meeting agenda. ⑥ In principle, discussions are conducted alternately in the order of pros and cons. ⑦ When discussions continue and cannot be easily concluded, members of the general meeting may submit a motion to terminate the discussion with the approval of two or more people. ⑧ When an agreement to terminate discussion is reached, the chairperson must ask the general meeting for approval. ⑨ When there are no more people debating or the motion to terminate the discussion under paragraph 8 has been passed, the chairperson shall declare the conclusion of the discussion.
